item.title: How to Beat MGS Delta Snake Eater Without Killing Anyone (Peace Walker Trophy)
item.description:
Pacifism is a core tenet of the series, so it makes sense that there's a trophy/achievement for not killing anyone in Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater . You can get through the entirety of Metal Gear Solid Delta without taking a single life, and that even includes the bosses you'll face along the way.

There are only so many non-lethal weapons in Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater , so your options are much more limited in a pacifist run. It's still much easier to earn the Peace Walker achievement/trophy than you'd think, however, and it'll only take a few hours. Here's how to beat Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater without killing anyone to unlock the Peace Walker trophy.

Spoiler Alert: Some minor spoilers are discussed below regarding what does and does not count as a lethal kill.

How to Beat MGS Delta Without Killing Anyone

Instead of worrying about limited suppressors and tranquilizer darts, the easiest way to complete Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater without killing anyone is to use the EZ Gun . This weapon is available on the Very Easy difficulty level , and it's essentially a tranquilizer gun with unlimited ammo that doesn't require suppressors, either. It also raises your camo index and makes you much harder to spot.

With the EZ Gun, you can blitz through every area of MGS Delta and just shoot any guard that gets in your way. It also makes boss fights much more manageable for a pacifist run, since you can just shoot them like normal and not have to worry about anything else. As long as you completely avoid lethal weapons during boss encounters, you'll have nothing to worry about.

What Counts as a Kill in Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater?

Kills only count if an enemy directly dies by your hand in Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater . Because of this distinction, you can get away with some surprisingly lethal strategies while keeping your overall kill count at zero.

If you tranquilize a guard on a hovercraft, and they end up crashing, for example, that won't count against you. The same goes for shooting an explosive barrel that just so happens to be next to an enemy or throwing a venomous animal at a guard. For some reason, those don't count as kills. You're also safe if any bikes crash and explode during the final chase sequence as long as you don't fire any lethal weapons yourself.

Knocking out a guard and having them drown, fall into a pit trap, or get electrocuted will count as a kill , however. If a vulture eats the body of an unconscious soldier , that's a kill as well.

Animals don't count as kills, so feel free to kill and eat anything you need to fill your stamina bar.

You can blast through Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater from start to finish in just a few hours with this method. While you can try to get the Peace Walker trophy on a higher difficulty, it's not worth the effort unless you're going for a specific title or challenge. It's better to just get the Peace Walker achievement out of the way so you can focus on harder trophies during your next Snake Eater run.

item.title: Call of Duty: Warzone’s Next Map May Have Already Been Shown Off
item.description:
Following a recent leak, Call of Duty: Warzone players are now questioning if the shooter's Season 5 trailer may have already revealed its rumored new Resurgence map. It has been suggested that the next Resurgence map will debut during Season 1 of Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 , but eagle-eyed Warzone fans have now discovered what appears to be the first official look at the potential new map.

On August 25, a credible industry insider and leaker revealed some potentially massive details surrounding a new Resurgence map for Call of Duty: Warzone . According to the leaker, the map will launch alongside Season 1 of Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 later this year. However, unlike the game's previous maps, this one is rumored to be an extended version of Liberty Falls from Black Ops 6 Zombies and will also feature other maps from the mode, such as Shattered Veil. While developers Treyarch and Raven are yet to reveal any official information surrounding the first season of Black Ops 7 , it looks like the two studios have already teased the rumored Resurgence map.

Warzone's Next Resurgence Map May Have Already Been Teased

Earlier this month, Call of Duty released its big Season 5 update for Black Ops 6 and Warzone . The update once again brought plenty of content to both titles, including some new weapons, maps, modes, cosmetics, and more. However, the official launch trailer for the new season seems to include a brief clip of what some believe to be the rumored Resurgence map. While the map itself is just the new Reckoning Zombies map from Black Ops 6 , the gameplay snippet from the trailer shows players dropping in via parachutes, similar to when players infill in Warzone . As the upcoming Resurgence map is rumored to consist of multiple Zombies maps, fans are speculating that this clip may be taken from Warzone and not Black Ops 6 Zombies.

As there has been no confirmation from Treyarch, Raven, or Activision surrounding the next Warzone map, fans should take this information with a pinch of salt. However, fans are already skeptical of the idea of a new Resurgence map for Warzone that solely consists of locations from previous Zombies maps. Plenty of users are calling the potential map "lazy" for it simply being reused assets, with one user saying, "Just more repurposed garbage. That’s all this game is now."

Rumors of a new Resurgence map appear to be adding to ongoing concerns surrounding Black Ops 7 , as the forthcoming entry in the series is seemingly struggling to generate any sort of positive momentum in the lead up to its launch. The worldwide reveal trailer for Black Ops 7 has not only reached nearly 400,000 dislikes, but it's also being bombarded with comments from fans stating that the trailer made them pre-order Battlefield 6 instead. This also comes as the PlayStation Store appears to have revealed that Battlefield 6 is currently outpacing Black Ops 7 in pre-orders.

item.title: Sony Reveals PlayStation Games Lineup for Tokyo Game Show 2025
item.description:
Sony has confirmed that PlayStation titles Ghost of Yotei , Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls , and Astro Bot will be part of the Tokyo Game Show 2025. While Astro Bot is a PS5-exclusive award-winning game from last year, Ghost of Yotei and Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls are two of the most awaited PlayStation console exclusives.

Another edition of the long-running Japanese video game exhibition, the Tokyo Game Show (TGS) is scheduled to take place from September 25-28 in Makuhari Messe, Chiba, Japan. In the build-up to the event, multiple game companies have confirmed their presence at the venue this year, with Sony being among the latest to do so. After showcasing a bunch of PlayStation games at TGS 2024 last year, the gaming giant is now getting ready to let people experience a new set of titles at TGS 2025 next month.

Ghost of Yotei and Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls to Make Appearances at the Tokyo Game Show 2025

Sony Interactive Entertainment announced that upcoming titles Ghost of Yotei and Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls , alongside Astro Bot , will make up its preliminary lineup of games at Tokyo Game Show 2025, according to the Japanese version of PlayStation.Blog (via Gematsu). It's important to note that the Ghost of Tsushima sequel and the Marvel-inspired fighting game will be part of the PlayStation booth, which is only accessible to industry professionals, on September 25 and September 26. On the other hand, Astro Bot will be there as part of the Family Game Park, which is open to the public, on September 27 and September 28. More games for the event will be revealed by Sony, alongside their schedule and more relevant information, in the future.

Thanks to this announcement, PlayStation fans may expect more glimpses and player impressions of Ghost of Yotei and Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls to be shared during TGS 2025. Given that the former game's launch is also set to follow on the heels of its appearance at the exhibition, fans won't have to wait too long before they can try it for themselves on October 2. Moreover, for those who don't get access to Marvel Tokon 's closed beta scheduled for early September, its TGS appearance may reveal interesting insights into the Sony-published title.

While certainly a big presence, Sony isn't the only major industry leader coming to TGS 2025, with Capcom also recently confirming its attendance. The renowned developer has already shared its plan to exhibit much-anticipated titles, including Resident Evil Requiem , Onimusha: Way of the Sword , Pragmata , and more, at the event.
